articles.author: Helen Reid, Benjamin Mallet, Sybille Hamaide
articles.description: Lady Gaga sang a French cabaret song near Notre-Dame cathedral, a giant plume of blue, white and red smoke was sent high above a bridge over the Seine and a winged man played accordion as the Olympics' opening ceremony got under way in Paris on Friday.
articles.title: Lady Gaga brings cabaret to Paris opening ceremony on the Seine

articles.author: Tim Reid, Stephanie Kelly, Jeff Mason
articles.description: Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump plans a campaign rally on Saturday in Minnesota as he tries to recapture momentum after Vice President Kamala Harris' whirlwind week that saw her emerge as his new Democratic opponent.
articles.title: Trump to rally in Minnesota, seeking to blunt Harris' campaign momentum

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Alleged Mexican kingpin Ismael El Mayo Zambada has pleaded not guilty to U.S. drug trafficking charges, court records showed on Friday, after he and a son of another drug lord were arrested on Thursday in El Paso, Texas.
articles.title: Mexican drug kingpin Ismael 'El Mayo' Zambada pleads not guilty to US charges

articles.author: Martin Petty
articles.description: Australia's foreign minister urged Myanmar's military rulers on Saturday to take a different path and end an intensifying civil war, as top diplomats of world powers gathered in Laos ahead of two summits seeking to tackle key global issues.
articles.title: Australia's Wong presses Myanmar generals to change tack ahead of Laos summits

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Israeli military told Palestinians to temporarily evacuate southern neighborhoods of Gaza's Khan Younis region so it could "forcefully operate" there, telling them to relocate to a humanitarian area in Al-Mawasi, a statement from the military said on Saturday.
articles.title: Israel tells Gazans to temporarily vacate southern Khan Younis areas

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: More than 27,000 people in northeast China were evacuated and hundreds of factories were ordered to suspend production as Typhoon Gaemi brought heavy rains, the official Xinhua news agency reported on Saturday.
articles.title: Typhoon Gaemi forces evacuation, factory suspension in northeast China

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Australia said on Saturday it had signed a A$2.2 billion ($1.4 billion) four-year contract with state-owned submarine builder ASC to upgrade the navy's Collins class submarines.
articles.title: Australia signs $1.4 bln deal to upgrade navy submarines

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi has warned the Philippines over the U.S. intermediate-range missile deployment, saying such a move could fuel regional tensions and spark an arms race.
articles.title: China's foreign minister warns Philippines over US missile deployment

articles.author: Valentini Anagnostopoulou
articles.description: Armed with selfie sticks and phones, the tourists flood into Santorini from everywhere - on dinghies from giant ocean liners, on coaches that zigzag up the steep hillsides, atop donkeys that clip-clop along the narrow cobbled streets.
articles.title: Greece's Santorini bursts with tourists as locals call for a cap

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Traffic on France's high-speed rail network should be back to normal by Monday, Transport Minister Patrice Vergriete said after sabotaged signal stations and cables caused travel chaos on Friday, the opening day of the Olympic Games.
articles.title: French rail traffic to return to normal Monday, minister says after sabotage
